metadata.title: CVE-2021-46144 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Roundcube before 1.4.13 and 1.5.x before 1.5.2 allows XSS via an HTMLe-mail message with crafted Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) token sequences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-core - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-mysql - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-pgsql - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-plugins - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.4.3+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: roundcube package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.3+dfsg.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
